channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6422] Import-Tool - Button placement
item.description:
The buttons "+" and "-" left and right of the quantity-field should be vertically centered like in the cart(screenshot attached for comparison). The buttons are actually at the bottom, this looks a little out of picture.

Requirement: The Buttons should look centered in relation to the quantity-field.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Please test
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6458] OCI // Show Company Name on Login Tab
item.description: Please show the company nameon the Login Tab of the OCI/ARIBA customers if they are logged in.
item.summary: OCI // Show Company Name on Login Tab

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Please test after the next deployment
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6438] Frontend bug on the "Warenkorb" button
item.description: The "Warenkorb" button on the Homepage is rendering below the navigation.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Angel
Did you had a minimized browser window?
Which browser did you use?

I need a screenshot of the complete browser window.

You are right:
Chrome 90% and all levels below 100%

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks
Please notify next deployment !!

We'll inform you early enough.
We have first to check if we'll do a hotfix deployment mid next week.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6437] JMeter load testing
item.description:
In order to prevent such errors in the future, we should do load testing with Jmeter, to simulate load on the test system.

http://jmeter.apache.org/

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
• committed in v3.2 distrelec_Q_ch.jmx
  • implemented Q web test for cms pages / product detail / category pages / login functionality
  • implemented for version: apache-jmeter-2.12

OPEN

  • checkout process integration (did not work for me, would need help for this point)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6436] My Account // Layout Issue
item.description: The sort dropdown in the order history, invoice history and approval workflow seems to be on the wrong position.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6434] Shoppinglists - Add list to cart button overlapping icons
item.description: The button to add shopping-list to cart is overlapping the icons (See printscreen),
item.summary: Shoppinglists - Add list to cart button overlapping icons

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6417] Import-Tool - Order of the products differ
item.description:
When an excel-list is imported, in the review of the file(Step 3) the products are not in the same order like in the sheet.

Note: In the sheet I increased quantity by 1 for every line-item. In that way I was able to discover this issue.

Requirement: In the file-review page(and in Shopping-Lists, Cart) the Products need to have the same order like in the corresponding sheet.
item.summary: Import-Tool - Order of the products differ

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please review

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6416] PIM Import // Send out status messages by email
item.description:
Please send out a email to a specific address (tbd) if a PIM import is finished.
For example the following dates should be in the mail.

13 Feb 2015 09:59:25
DEBUG [Timer-65] [ServiceLayerPimExportParser] Processed items from file [DIS_65_hun.xml]:
Category: 12221
ClassAttributeAssignment: 7940
ClassificationAttribute: 5329
ClassificationAttributeUnit: 365
ClassificationAttributeUnit:Skipped: 365
DistDownloadMedia: 68850
DistDownloadMedia:Skipped: 21
DistVideoMedia: 214
DistVideoMedia:Skipped: 92
MediaContainer: 98563
MediaContainer:Skipped: 98423
Product: 81244
Product:Skipped: 69822
—
Totally imported: 443449 items.
Actually: 0.7 items/s.
Duration: 09h 28m 31s
item.summary: PIM Import // Send out status messages by email

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I added the final log message to the PIM import notification email.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6380] Add productHierarchy in PIM export file
item.description: Please export also the product hierarchy code in the pim export. Could please attach a dummy xml snippet how it is exported? Important for us, to know how we can import it.
item.summary: Add productHierarchy in PIM export file

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: change the pim import accordingly

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6365] Remove sentence in all countries
item.description:
Please remove the marked sentence in the screenshot for all countries.

Reason: On small screens this useless sentence uses too much space on the screen.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please remove the marked sentence in all countries.

Please test after the next deployment
thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6346] New error filter message
item.description:
Change text to:

Sorry!
We could not find any products for the selected filters, 
please modify your search or contact us for assistance.

Button: Back to search results (functionality: same as current click on "ok")

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Daniela
Could you please let us know where exactly you want to change this text?
When you select multiple filters which give no result. We get a popup there, where we'd like to change the text.

Okay.
We'll change it.
Could you please organize the translations?
Thx.
Laura will take care of them.
Please find attached the translations

Hello
What is the latest status? can you implement the new text before the next deployment?
Thanks,
Laura

Hi Laura,
The texts will be put to the next property-translation-round. We'll import them as soon as we have all the translations back for the next round.
BR, Rafael
Hi Nabil, please integrate the attached translation-changes to the next round, thx.
Fixed. Should be available on Q after next deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6344] Suggest layer adjustments
item.description:
1) Display arrow right below the search box (Screenshot IV - if repositioning of the two boxes cannot be done)
2) If no category suggestions nor brands: reduce the width of the layer and display product suggestions on the left side (screenshots V & VI)
3) If no product suggestions: delete the column with the products so only category suggestions and manufactures are shown

--> cf suggest layer of Conrad (http://www.conrad.biz/ce/de/)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Due to the implementation of DISTRELEC-6343, will diregard 1)

Assumptions:

  • regarding 2): If no category suggestions, nor brands, nor search term suggestions: ...
  • Width of the respective columns remains unchanged when they each stand alone

Estimation: 0.5-1d

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5122] SEO - MicroData Optimization
item.description:
Observations :

  • Microdata well tagged on webpages allow a very high CTR on the SERP.
  • We are using Price Microdata on our products :
  • We are not using the full set of microdata offered to us by Google :

Impacts :

  • We are not exploiting all the traffic we could gather due to lower CTR compared to the competition on our results inside the serps.

Demands :

Insert those Microdata tagging (https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/) :

  • "Stock" Microdata type (only products pages with stock available):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<div itemprop="name">LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27, COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27, Philips</div>
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<div itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF"></div>
		<div itemprop="price" content="13.90"></div>
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />
	</div>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab5453d87218f7f6fe373c989&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata type (only Category pages)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for https://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-234938 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$lowest_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this ($lowest_product_price="576.72") : 
      <div itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope="" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
	Price from
	<meta itemprop="currency" content="CHF">CHF
	<meta itemprop="lowprice" content="576.72">576.72	
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:800505ea66a4e0bf569562f368eac52d
    • Code effect :
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata type (on Products and Category pages):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/185417
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 :
      The breadcrumb already in place must be tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/c/cat-L1D_379521"><span itemprop="title">Power Supplies & Lighting</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="/http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/c/cat-L2D_379659"><span itemprop="title">Light sources</span></a>
</div>	
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/c/cat-L3D_525567"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/c/cat-16343"><span itemprop="title">LED lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span></a>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036847c3d640f474aba15e7ff7dd&hl=en
    • Code effect :
Here is a new one, you can try it
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type (Only for the Home page):
    • Documentation : https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/sitelinkssearch
    • Code for http://www.distrelec.ch pages html head : 
      <script type="application/ld+json">
{
	"@context": "http://schema.org",
	"@type": "WebSite",
	"url": "http://www.distrelec.ch/",
	"potentialAction": {
		"@type": "SearchAction",
		"target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term_string}",
		"query-input": "required name=search_term_string"
	}
}
</script>
    • Code effect :

Checking process :

  • Copy paste of the html inside the richsnippets test plateform : http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets (no pre-visualization = µdata wrongly implemented !)
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

Deprecated Demand (Don't implement it):

  • "Price" & "Stock" Microdata type (on Category pages with only one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635 :
      A pharse saying "Price CHF$product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">Oscilloscopes, Agilent DSO1000B
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<span itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF">CHF
		<span itemprop="price" content="557.28">557.28
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />In stock
	</div>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab444381da09c62327bce7f5b&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Price range" Microdata type (only on Category pages with more than one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$min_product_price to CHF$max_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span>
	<span itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
		Price from CHF
		<span itemprop="lowPrice">10.10</span>
		to CHF
		<span itemprop="highPrice">14.90</span>
		<meta itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF" />
	</span>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab30fc481691f41d2c451ce41&hl=en
    • Code effect :

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please don't implement the sitelinksearch box yet, apparently it's bugged.

And just to be sure, every time I'm writing an url http://www.distrelec.ch/* it's for the exemple concerning http://www.distrelec.ch/.
If the domain is *.distrelec.de/de or *.distrelec.it it has to be inside the µdata the corresponding domain and language path.

Status update :

  • "Stock" Microdata : Ready in dev environment
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata : in finalization in dev environment
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata : Ready in dev environment
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata : Ready in dev environment

Hallo Ruben,

Could you do those Frontend stuff, which we had just discussed now please.

Please do it in a special branch which I had created for seo stuff ( https://svn.namics.com/Distrelec/Distrelec-Relaunch-2012-intern/branches/feature-sku-5122-seo_microdata)

The FE is done.
Thanks

done!.

Need to be controlled why such things happened. I see it perfect in my local development, but not in q and p.
Waiting for Francesco Bersani | Distrelec and Nabil Benothman | Distrelec

Ruben Diaz Roman | Distrelec I will assign it to you because I am not able to commit it from the branch. (i.e, My repository is pointing to namics svn.)

I have implemented all the necessary code, So let us commit it from your development environment.
Changes commited.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6467] Punchout improvements
item.description:
• Remove CategoryInterceptor
  • Remove ProductInterceptor
  • Synchronizing producthierarchy from product to category
  • Synchronizing producthierarchy from punchouts to customer
  • Parameter to switch off/on punchout logic
  • Completly deactivate punchout logic for anonymous
  • Add producthierarchy to PIM import
  • Testing complete functionality
  • Testing with Jmeter load test

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment:
Committed in v3.2:

  • Remove CategoryInterceptor -> done.
  • Remove ProductInterceptor -> done.
  • Synchronizing producthierarchy from product to category -> done.
  • Synchronizing producthierarchy from punchouts to customer -> done (but only tested local with 16 customers. Need to test it on Q with useful data).
  • Parameter to switch off/on punchout logic -> done.
  • Completly deactivate punchout logic for anonymous -> done.
  • Add producthierarchy to PIM import -> done.

OPEN

  • SAP PunchoutFilter interface: submit the producthierarchy information with the punchout filter interface from SAP: http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/IF-05+PunchOut+Filters
  • Where does the producthierarchy information for the product come from? SAP or PIM?
    -> I checked 5 products in erp & pim file. They had the same product hierarchy code defined.
  • Jmeter checkout process integration (only if needed)
    -> http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-6437
  • Testing (sync jobs / login / switch off/on punchout logic / anonymous user / pim import / sap punchoutfilter interface / jmeter Q web test)
